item.title: Duke students walk out of Seinfeld commencement speech
item.description: Students at Duke walked out of the graduation ceremony during comedian Jerry Seinfeld's commencement speech. The demonstration comes amid a wave of anti-war protests on college campuses.

media:content.media:title: Duke students walk out of Seinfeld commencement speech
media:content.media:description: Students at Duke walked out of the graduation ceremony during comedian Jerry Seinfeld's commencement speech. The demonstration comes amid a wave of anti-war protests on college campuses.

item.title: Trump, gun owners and Jan. 6 rioters: Tough-on-crime Justice Alito displays empathy for some criminal defendants
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Hurley
item.description: Conservative Justice Samuel Alito, a former U.S. attorney with a long history of voting in favor of prosecutors, has shown signs of empathy for defendants.

media:content.media:text: Associate Justice Samuel Alito in Washington, DC. on April 23, 2021.
media:content.media:description: Justice Samuel Alito in 2021.

item.title: Sen. Lindsey Graham says Israel should do 'whatever' it has to, comparing the war in Gaza to WWII
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Marquez
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham says Israel should do 'whatever' it has to while comparing the war in Gaza to Hiroshima and Nagasaki

media:content.media:text: Lindsey Graham
media:content.media:description: Lindsey Graham on March 18, 2024.

item.title: Biden taps Obama, George Clooney, Julia Roberts and the Clintons for mega fundraisers
item.dc:creator: Monica Alba and Mike Memoli
item.description: President Joe Biden’s campaign plans to host a major fundraiser in Los Angeles next month with former President Barack Obama and Hollywood superstars George Clooney and Julia Roberts, according to a campaign official.

media:content.media:text: Joe Biden
media:content.media:description: Joe Biden during a campaign event in Raleigh, N.C., on March 26, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Julia Roberts and George Clooney
media:content.media:description: Julia Roberts and George Clooney arrive for the premiere of "Ticket to Paradise" in Westwood, Calif., on Oct. 17, 2022.

item.title: Putin sacks Sergei Shoigu as defense minister, appoints him as leader of security council
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Russia’s President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed replacing Sergei Shoigu as defense minister and appointed him as secretary of Russia’s national security council.

media:content.media:text: Shanghai Cooperation Organisation defence ministers meet in Astana
media:content.media:description: Then-Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu in Astana, Kazakhstan, on April 26.

item.title: WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert on the meteoric rise of women’s basketball
item.description: It is shaping up to be the most high-profile season ever for the WNBA. And now the league’s Commissioner, Cathy Engelbert, wants to keep that excitement growing for years to come. But she recognizes there is still a lot of work to be done–in particular, on player salaries. NBC News’ Hallie Jackson has more in a special one-on-one with Commissioner Engelbert.

media:content.media:title: WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert on the meteoric rise of women’s basketball
media:content.media:description: It is shaping up to be the most high-profile season ever for the WNBA. And now the league’s Commissioner, Cathy Engelbert, wants to keep that excitement growing for years to come. But she recognizes there is still a lot of work to be done–in particular, on player salaries. NBC News’ Hallie Jackson has more in a special one-on-one with Commissioner Engelbert.

item.title: In the mystery of Florida’s bizarre spinning fish, a leading suspect has emerged
item.dc:creator: Evan Bush
item.description: A mysterious ailment causing fish in the Florida Keys to spin in circles and die has touched off a race to find the cause and save the endangered sawfish.

media:content.media:text: A sawfish sticks it's head out of the water
media:content.media:description: A sawfish in Islamorada, Fla., in 2015.

item.title: Here's the biggest news you missed this weekend
item.dc:creator: Josh Feldman and Nick Duffy
item.description: Does the U.S. have a 'red line' for aid to Israel?Biden enlists A-listers George Clooney and Julia Roberts for a fundraiser. And behind-the-scenes turmoil at Miss USA.

media:content.media:description: Northern lights appear in the night sky above the Brocken in Schierke, northern Germany on Saturday, May 11, 2024.

item.title: Steve Buscemi punched while walking in New York City
item.dc:creator: Angela Yang
item.description: Acclaimed actor Steve Buscemi was walking in New York City last week when someone punched him in broad daylight on a Manhattan street.

media:content.media:text: Steve Buscemi attends a premiere in New York on on April 27, 2023.
media:content.media:description: Steve Buscemi at a premiere in New York on April 27, 2023.

item.title: Michael Cohen set to testify as key witness in Trump hush money trial
item.description: Former President Trump’s fixer-turned-foe Michael Cohen is set to begin testifying Monday in Trump’s Manhattan criminal trial related to hush money payments Cohen paid to adult film actress Stormy Daniels. NBC News’ Dasha Burns reports.

media:content.media:title: Michael Cohen set to testify as key witness in Trump hush money trial
media:content.media:description: Former President Trump’s fixer-turned-foe Michael Cohen is set to begin testifying Monday in Trump’s Manhattan criminal trial related to hush money payments Cohen paid to adult film actress Stormy Daniels. NBC News’ Dasha Burns reports.

item.title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: Sound and Fury
item.description: When the wife of a popular Atlanta DJ is found murdered in their home, investigators try to unravel what happened. Stephanie Gosk reports Friday, May 10, at 9/8c on NBC.

media:content.media:title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: Sound and Fury
media:content.media:description: When the wife of a popular Atlanta DJ is found murdered in their home, investigators try to unravel what happened. Stephanie Gosk reports Friday, May 10, at 9/8c on NBC.

item.title: Plane with 3 aboard lands without landing gear at Australian airport after burning off fuel
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: A light plane with three people aboard landed safely without landing gear Monday after circling an Australian airport for almost three hours to burn off fuel.

media:content.media:text: A light plane with three people aboard lands safely without landing gear at Newcastle Airport, Australia, Monday, May 13, 2024, after circling the airport for almost three hours to burn off fuel.
media:content.media:description: A light plane with three people aboard lands safely without landing gear Monday at Newcastle Airport in Australia after circling the airport for almost three hours to burn off fuel.

item.title: Boater flees after fatally striking girl who was waterskiing in Florida
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Cohen
item.description: Florida's fish and wildlife commission was searching for a boater who fled after fatally striking a girl Saturday afternoon near Nixon Beach in Key Biscayne.

media:content.media:text: Boats in the water as the sun sets in the background.
media:content.media:description: Authorities in Floria were searching for a boater who fled after fatally striking a girl on Saturday.

item.title: Thomas Jefferson University apologizes after commencement mispronunciations go viral
item.dc:creator: Maddie Ellis, TODAY
item.description: Thomas Jefferson University is apologizing after the names of some graduates from the nursing program were unrecognizably pronounced at their commencement, as seen in videos from the ceremony that have since gone viral.

media:content.media:text: Thomas Jefferson University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
media:content.media:description: Thomas Jefferson University in Philadelphia.

item.title: WNBA commissioner says league ready to capitalize on momentum: 'Our phones are ringing off the hook'
item.dc:creator: Rob Wile
item.description: The WNBA stands on the precipice of a mainstream explosion — but the league must still get broadcast and other investment deals in place to build a stable financial foundation, according to WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert.

media:content.media:text: Cathy Engelbert smiles for a portrait on the court
media:content.media:description: WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert during the WNBA All-Star Friday at Michelob ULTRA Arena in Las Vegas on July 14, 2023.

media:content.media:text: Caitlin Clark, left, holds an Indiana Fever jersey and poses for a photo with Cathy Engelbert
media:content.media:description: Caitlin Clark and WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert on April 15 after the Indiana Fever selected Clark first overall at the WNBA draft.

item.title: GOP Sen. JD Vance says he will accept results if the election is 'free and fair'
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz
item.description: Potential vice presidential contender Sen. JD Vance said Sunday that he would "totally plan" to accept the 2024 presidential election results — if the election is "free and fair."

media:content.media:text: Senator J.D. Vance
media:content.media:description: Sen. JD Vance leaves the Capitol on May 2.

item.title: Exiled Chinese billionaire's alleged accomplice pleads guilty in massive fraud conspiracy
item.dc:creator: Chloe Atkins
item.description: Yvette Wang, an accomplice of indicted Chinese billionaire Guo Wengui, pleaded guilty in New York last week to defrauding investors out of over $1 billion dollars in "a complex scheme," prosecutors said.

media:content.media:text: The Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse in New York on Tuesday, Oct. 3, 2023.
media:content.media:description: The Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse in New York on Tuesday, Oct. 3, 2023.

item.title: Social media users are collectively blocking celebrities and influencers who have been silent on Gaza
item.dc:creator: Angela Yang
item.description: Hundreds of celebrities are on the “digital guillotine” as social media users campaign for a #blockout — urging one another to block the social media accounts of big names who have remained silent about the ongoing humanitarian atrocities in Gaza.

media:content.media:text: Haley Kalil departs The Mark Hotel for the Met Gala; miniature cakes float
media:content.media:description: Haley Kalil's “Let Them Eat Cake" Met Gala TikTok video sparked a movement on social media in response to celebrity silence about the devastation in Gaza.

media:content.media:text: Kirsten Dunst in a scene from Sofia Coppola's Marie Antoinette.
media:content.media:description: A scene from Sofia Coppola's "Marie Antoinette," the 2006 movie from which the "Let Them Eat Cake" TikTok sound originated.

media:content.media:text: Police intervened pro-Palestine demonstration in New York City
media:content.media:description: Police officers intervene during a pro-Palestinian demonstration in New York on May 6 organized to show solidarity with Palestinians.

item.title: At least 11 dead in Mother’s Day weekend shootings across the country
item.dc:creator: Mirna Alsharif and Dennis Romero and Austin Mullen and Elizabeth Maline and TJ Swigart and Emilie Dorn and Donna Mendell
item.description: At least 11 people, including a teenager, were killed in a spate of weekend shootings from Florida to Massachusetts.

media:content.media:text: Two people are dead and four others wounded after a shooting at an Atlanta club early Sunday May 12, 2024, morning, according to Atlanta Police.
media:content.media:description: Two people were killed and four others wounded in a shooting at an Atlanta club early Sunday, police said.

item.title: Western Canada blazes cause evacuation orders, air quality concerns
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: TORONTO — The season’s first major wildfires have spread to roughly 19,000 acres across Western Canada on Sunday as authorities issued an evacuation order for a community in British Columbia and warned of poor air quality across provinces.

media:content.media:text: Smoke rises from mutual aid wildfire GCU007 in the Grande Prairie Forest Area
media:content.media:description: Smoke rises from a wildfire in the Grande Prairie Forest Area near TeePee Creek in Alberta, Canada, on Friday.

item.title: 2024 NBA draft lottery: Atlanta Hawks win No. 1 pick
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosenstein
item.description: The Atlanta Hawks on Sunday won the right to select the No. 1 overall pick in the NBA draft on June 27.

media:content.media:text: NBA commish commisioner
media:content.media:description: NBA Commissioner Adam Silver during the NBA’s All-Star weekend in Indianapolis on Feb. 17.

item.title: Putin sacks Sergei Shoigu as defense minister, appoints him as leader of security council
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Russia’s President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed replacing Sergei Shoigu as defense minister and appointed him as secretary of Russia’s national security council.

media:content.media:text: Shanghai Cooperation Organisation defence ministers meet in Astana
media:content.media:description: Then-Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu in Astana, Kazakhstan, on April 26.

item.title: Arsenal takes title race with Man City to final day of Premier League season
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: The Premier League title race will go to the last day of the season after Arsenal returned to the top of the standings with a 1-0 win at Manchester United on Sunday.

media:content.media:text: Arsenal's Leandro Trossard, centre, scores
media:content.media:description: Arsenal's Leandro Trossard, center, scores during the match between Manchester United and Arsenal on Sunday.

item.title: Duke students walk out of Jerry Seinfeld's commencement speech amid wave of anti-war protests
item.dc:creator: Doha Madani and Rebecca Cohen
item.description: Comedian Jerry Seinfeld was met with a wave of boos Sunday when students at Duke University in North Carolina walked out just before his commencement speech, the latest in a wave of antiwar protests at college graduations across the country this weekend.

media:content.media:text: Jerry Seinfeld
media:content.media:description: Jerry Seinfeld in Los Angeles on April 30, 2024.
